title: NYT > Movies
copyright: Copyright 2022 The New York Times Company

items.title: The Best Films of 2022, So Far
items.description: Here are the movies that our critics say have made the year a strong one onscreen.

items.title: ‘Minions: The Rise of Gru’ Review: They’re Yellow but Not Mellow
items.description: This latest edition featuring the animated creatures is an origin story of sorts for their master, Gru.
items.author: Glenn Kenny

items.title: ‘Hallelujah’ Review: From Leonard Cohen to Cale to Buckley to Shrek
items.description: A new documentary tells the entwined stories of a songwriter and his best-known composition.
items.author: A.O. Scott

items.title: ‘Down With the King’ Review: A Rapper in the Wilderness
items.description: In Diego Ongaro’s patient and subtle new film, Freddie Gibbs plays a hip-hop artist struggling with a career malaise.
items.author: A.O. Scott

items.title: Taika Waititi on “Thor” and “Our Flag Means Death"
items.description: The “Thor: Love and Thunder” director can’t say no — to starring in “Our Flag Means Death,” making a soccer movie, writing a “Star Wars” idea, adapting Roald Dahl. For starters.
items.author: Dave Itzkoff

items.title: ‘The Princess’ Review: Holding His Heart in Her Hands
items.description: Joey King is credible and compelling as a vengeful would-be princess bride in this over-the-top action fantasy tale.
items.author: Amy Nicholson

items.title: Behind the Scenes of ‘Marcel the Shell With Shoes On’
items.description: How did “Marcel the Shell With Shoes On,” a short created in one person’s bedroom, become a full-scale, stop-motion feature film? Meticulously.
items.author: Jason Bailey

items.title: ‘Fourth of July’ Review: Fraught Family Dynamics From Louis C.K.
items.description: The comedian directs, co-writes and takes a supporting role in this family dramedy. It’s not supposed to be his show, but it is anyway.
items.author: Glenn Kenny

items.title: ‘Beauty’ Review: Requiem for a Pop Star
items.description: The ghost of Whitney Houston haunts “Beauty,” the story of a singer, her family and best friend on the edge of fame.
items.author: Lisa Kennedy

items.title: Trying to Capture the Life and Lyrics of That Wry Sage Leonard Cohen
items.description: The makers of a documentary on the singer-songwriter took a deep dive into his “writing and rewriting and erasing” to better understand the man.
items.author: Nicolas Rapold

items.title: Five International Movies to Stream Now
items.description: This month’s picks include an unconventional French rom-com, a triptych about Indigenous women in Mexico, a provincial Tamil satire and more.
items.author: Devika Girish

items.title: Watch Austin Butler Cause Hysteria in ‘Elvis’
items.description: The director Baz Luhrmann narrates a sequence in which Elvis gives an early performance that stirs up the audience.
items.author: Mekado Murphy

items.title: ‘Elvis’ | Anatomy of a Scene
items.description: Baz Luhrmann narrates a sequence from his biopic starring Austin Butler and Tom Hanks.
items.author: Mekado Murphy

items.title: ‘Mr. Malcolm’s List’ Review: A Finalist for His Affection
items.description: Upper-crust courtship comes with undercooked social commentary in this Regency-era romance.
items.author: Amy Nicholson

items.title: ‘The Forgiven’ Review: When the Haves Dispose of a Have-Not
items.description: Ralph Fiennes and Jessica Chastain play an unhappy couple who accidentally kill a stranger in Morocco en route to a desert bacchanal.
items.author: Manohla Dargis

items.title: ‘Accepted’ Review: Reaching for the Stars, Seeing Them Dissolve
items.description: After a scandal unravels at their private school in western Louisiana, four seniors pick up the pieces.
items.author: Beandrea July

items.title: ‘Clara Sola’ Review: Breaking Free
items.description: A 40-year-old woman, believed to be blessed with divine powers, has her sexual awakening in Nathalie Álvarez Mesén’s debut feature.
items.author: Devika Girish

items.title: ‘Sniper: The White Raven’ Review: Rage and Resilience
items.description: This slick fictional portrait of a Ukrainian sniper begins in tranquillity before thrusting us into the silent brutality of the battlefield.
items.author: Natalia Winkelman

items.title: ‘Rubikon’ Review: Waiting to Inhale
items.description: In this somber morality tale, the bare-bones crew of a space station is faced with an impossible choice.
items.author: Jeannette Catsoulis

items.title: Mary Mara, Actress on ‘ER,’ ‘Dexter’ and ‘Nash Bridges,’ Dies at 61
items.description: She appeared in dozens of movies and television shows in a career of more than 30 years. The police said they believed she died in a drowning accident.
items.author: Amisha Padnani

items.title: ‘The Art of Making It’ Review: Seeking a Bigger Canvas
items.description: Despite its haphazard approach, this documentary about the contemporary art world serves as a decent explainer for the industry’s fraught dynamics.
items.author: Beatrice Loayza

items.title: Stream These Three Great Documentaries
items.description: This month’s nonfiction picks include a reflection on a father, a immersive dive into the fishing industry and an alternative approach to the rock band biopic doc.
items.author: Ben Kenigsberg

items.title: ‘The Man From Toronto’ Review: Not So Clearly Canadian
items.description: Woody Harrelson plays a hit man and Kevin Hart the wrong man in this Netflix action comedy.
items.author: Calum Marsh

items.title: ‘Endangered’ Review: When Journalism Becomes Imperiled
items.description: A new documentary from Heidi Ewing and Rachel Grady explores threats to press freedom, but not with the focus this global issue deserves.
items.author: Ben Kenigsberg

items.title: ‘Doula’ Review: Rules of Contraction
items.description: An expectant mother and a male birthing counselor learn to get along in this dry, refreshingly candid comedy.
items.author: Jeannette Catsoulis

items.title: Stream These 9 Movies and Shows Before They Leave Netflix in July
items.description: Subscribers in the United States will lose a classic ’90s rom-com among other delightful titles. Watch these while you can.
items.author: Jason Bailey

items.title: When an Abortion Story Is Told as a Caper, Thriller or Farce
items.description: As Roe falls, new works including a documentary, a feature film and a comedy show disrupt the taboos and clichés around abortion.
items.author: Amanda Hess

items.title: The Best Actors to Play Elvis Onscreen
items.description: In honor of Austin Butler’s performance in the Baz Luhrmann biopic, we ranked 10 of the best — and worst — Presleys to grace the silver screen.
items.author: Sarah Bahr
